seg.seg: ... oh merciful one, you know also the proper way for all
... to give the proper way of monkhood; I, too, am going to embrace the way revered by everyone
... My (noble) son! Ever since I attained the rank of Buddha
... in (my) teaching, your effort of three Asaṃkhyeyas will come to fruition when you go away from the house
... there will be expansion, and those who will observe your going away from the house (will) hear (?)

… there will be expansion, and those who will observe your going away from the house (will) hear (?) … (they) will revere and praise; all these beings … certainly among gods and mortals, divine and human … having come, according to your teaching, will be freed from the cycle of existences through going away from the house. (cf 135)
... (they) revere and praise; all these beings ... certainly among gods and mortals, divine and human
... having come, according to your teaching, will be freed from the circle of existences through going away from the house. Therefore, go you away, noble one! according to (my) teaching (?)
... with (immense) joy, overjoyed, with body bowed and palms placed together, through the threefold refuge-taking, ... the Buddha-god
... (||) Following you, who has gone away from the house, oh venerable one, will I go away from the house; I will embrace the way that you have embraced. The Buddha-god the teacher
Following you, who has left the house, o venerable one, I am leaving the house; I am embracing the way that you have embraced. (cf 135)
... I am going to the protector of ... Do accept me as a monk who has taken the vows! For the rest of my life, ... having received ...
... having said (that), the venerable Metrak bowed down low, and right away (his guise) as a person going away from the house
... and he became visible in the guise of a monk. Thereupon the earth in the three-thousandfold world (trembled) as if on water
... || The entire sky was ﬁlled with great gods – they veiled it as it were: (on Mount) Pāṣāṇaka
... in the direction of (all worlds): sādhu sādhu, good good! The noble Metrak has ﬁnally gone away from the house
... the going away from the house; the ﬁve incarnations rejoiced, the (four) directions shone
... sandalwood powder (and) delicate perfumes; divine (ﬂowers) rained

p.note: This fragment contains part of the second act of the Maitreyasamitināṭaka; an Uy. parallel is MaitrHami II, 15b (end)-16b27, with a3 here = MaitrHami II, 16a2. See also 195-6.
The translation and the following commentary are adapted from 136.

According to Prof. Li Jingwei (p.c.), a parallel is found in MaitrHami 2, 15 b26-29, which may be translated as follows: "You are merciful. With your complete wisdom you can surely understand the cherished desire of all living beings".

Cf. the Uyghur text in the Turfan recension, Taf. 119 v. 1 ff. (57), and in the Hami recension, MaitrHami 2, 16 a1ff.; the end of the present leaf corresponds to MaitrHami 2, 16 b25, and in the Turfan recension, to Taf. 18, v. 4 (59).

The Uyghur text is somewhat different for the beginning of this speech, cf. MaitrHami 2, 16 a26ff, and Turfan recension, Taf. 18, r. 1-9. This is the first word of a stanza of the type 20(5/5/5/5) + 22(8/7/7) + 10(5/5) + 15(8/7).
